title: WNBA in Kansas City ? KC Current ownership group meets with league
body_text:
KC Current ownership group, including Mahomes family, reportedly meets with WNBA
Could Kansas City welcome a new sports franchise soon?
ESPN’s Adam Schefter reports that the KC Current's ownership group, which includes Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes and his wife, Brittany, are in talks with the WNBA to potentially bring a franchise to Kansas City.
The Current's ownership group built the world’s first stadium exclusively for a women’s professional sports team.
"As WNBA expansion continues, ownership of the NWSL's KC Current — which includes Patrick Mahomes and his wife, Brittany — has met with the WNBA and is in contention to bring the league's next franchise to Kansas City," Schefter reported.
The WNBA currently has 12 teams.
Over the next few seasons, the league will expand by three, with new franchises in the San Francisco Bay Area, Toronto, and Portland.
The league aims to add a 16th team by the start of the 2028 season.
With the arrival of Caitlin Clark, the WNBA saw a ratings boost in 2024.
Game 5 of the recent WNBA Finals was the most-watched Finals game in 25 years.
Patrick Mahomes is also a part owner of the Kansas City Royals and Sporting Kansas City.
